title: Chicken Parmesan
description: This optimized chicken Parmesan recipe features a crispy crust, less sauce, and the perfect blend of mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, pounded to 1/4-inch thickness
instructions: In a large skillet, heat 1/4 cup olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic and cook until softened and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add the crushed tomatoes and fresh basil leaves to the skillet. Simmer the sauce for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
In a shallow bowl, mix together the panko breadcrumbs and 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese.
Dip the pounded chicken breasts in the beaten eggs, then dredge them in the panko-Parmesan mixture, pressing to help the crumbs adhere.
In a large skillet, heat 1/4 inch of vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Fry the breaded chicken in batches for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy.
Preheat the oven to 400°F. Place the fried chicken in a baking dish and top each piece with some of the prepared tomato sauce and shredded mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve the chicken Parmesan hot, garnished with additional fresh basil if desired.
variations: Add a sprinkle of Italian seasoning or red pepper flakes to the panko-Parmesan coating for extra flavor.
Substitute fresh mozzarella slices for the shredded mozzarella cheese.
Serve the chicken Parmesan over a bed of spaghetti or linguine.
troubleshooting: Q: Why is my chicken Parmesan soggy? A: Make sure to fully fry the chicken until it's crispy before baking, and use just enough sauce to cover the top rather than drowning the chicken.
Q: How do I keep the breading from falling off? A: Ensure the chicken is thoroughly coated in the egg wash and panko-Parmesan mixture, and press the breading firmly onto the chicken before frying.

title: Lasagna
description: This classic lasagna recipe is made with an easy meat sauce as the base. Layer the sauce with noodles and cheese, then bake until bubbly! This is great for feeding a big family and freezes well, too.
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package fresh mushrooms, coarsely chopped
instructions: Start by making the sauce with ground beef, bell peppers, onions, and a combo of tomato sauce, tomato paste, and crushed tomatoes.
Let this simmer while you boil the noodles and get the cheeses ready.
We're using ricotta, shredded mozzarella, and parmesan—like the mix of tomatoes, this 3-cheese blend gives the lasagna great flavor!
From there, it's just an assembly job. A cup of meat sauce, a layer of noodles, more sauce, followed by a layer of cheese. Repeat until you have three layers and have used up all the ingredients.
Bake until bubbly and you're ready to eat!
variations: Use all beef or all sausage instead of a combination
Try ground chicken or ground turkey instead of beef/sausage
Make a vegetable lasagna as a meatless variation
Reduce the cheese by skipping the mozzarella inside the layers and just sprinkling it on top
troubleshooting: Q: Why is my lasagna watery? A: Make sure to let the lasagna rest for 20 minutes before slicing, which helps the cheese and sauce set up.
Q: My noodles are stuck together! A: Be sure to boil the noodles until just tender, not fully cooked. Also, toss the cooked noodles with a bit of olive oil to prevent sticking.

title: Meatloaf
description: A simple, classic homemade meatloaf recipe that's comfort food at its best, as shared by comedian Carol Burnett.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, eggs, milk, 1/2 cup of the tomato sauce, onion, bell pepper, breadcrumbs, garlic salt, and onion salt. Mix until well incorporated.
Transfer the meatloaf mixture to a baking sheet or loaf pan and shape into a loaf.
Bake for 50 minutes.
Remove from oven and spread the remaining tomato sauce over the top of the meatloaf.
Return to oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
Let rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing and serving.
variations: Add grated cheddar cheese to the meatloaf mixture
Mix in sautéed mushrooms or spinach
Top with bacon or crispy onions
troubleshooting: Q: Why is my meatloaf dry or crumbly? A: Make sure not to overmix the ingredients and use the proper ratio of breadcrumbs to prevent the meatloaf from becoming too dense.
Q: My meatloaf is falling apart when I slice it. A: Ensure you are using a finer ground beef and mincing the onions very finely to help bind the loaf together.
Q: The glaze is too sweet/tangy. A: Adjust the ratio of ketchup, brown sugar, and Worcestershire sauce to your taste preferences.
